verses.verse: Let me sing<WH7891> now<WH4994> for my well-beloved<WH1730> A song<WH9598> of my beloved concerning His vineyard.<WH3754> My well-beloved had<WH1961> a vineyard<WH3754> on a fertile<WH1121> <WH8081> hill.<WH7161>

And He dug<WH5823> it all around,<WH5823> removed<WH5619> its stones,<WH5619> And planted<WH5193> it with the choicest<WH8321> vine.<WH8321> And He built<WH1129> a tower<WH4026> in the middle<WH8432> of it, And hewed<WH2672> out a wine<WH3342> vat<WH3342> in it; Then He expected<WH6960> [it] to produce<WH6213> [good] grapes,<WH6025> But it produced<WH6213> [only] worthless<WH891> ones.<WH891>
"And now,<WH6258> O inhabitants<WH3427> of Jerusalem<WH3389> and men<WH376> of Judah,<WH3063> Judge<WH8199> between<WH996> Me and My vineyard.<WH3754>

"What<WH4100> more<WH5750> was there to do<WH6213> for My vineyard<WH3754> that I have not done<WH6213> in it? Why,<WH4069> when I expected<WH6960> [it] to produce<WH6213> [good] grapes<WH6025> did it produce<WH6213> worthless<WH891> ones<WH891>?

"So now<WH6258> let Me tell<WH3045> you what<WH834> I am going to do<WH6213> to My vineyard:<WH3754> I will remove<WH5493> its hedge<WH9299> and it will be consumed;<WH1197> I will break<WH6555> down<WH6555> its wall<WH1447> and it will become<WH1961> trampled<WH4823> ground.<WH4823>

"And I will lay<WH7896> it waste;<WH1326> It will not be pruned<WH2168> or hoed,<WH9386> But briars<WH8068> and thorns<WH7898> will come<WH5927> up. I will also charge<WH6680> the clouds<WH5645> to rain<WH4305> no<WH4480> rain<WH4306> on it."

For the vineyard<WH3754> of the Lord<WH3068> of hosts<WH6635> is the house<WH1004> of Israel,<WH3478> And the men<WH376> of Judah<WH3063> His delightful<WH8191> plant.<WH5194> Thus He looked<WH6960> for justice,<WH4941> but behold,<WH2009> bloodshed;<WH4939> For righteousness,<WH6666> but behold,<WH2009> a cry<WH6818> of distress.<WH6818>

Woe<WH1945> to those who add<WH5060> house<WH1004> to house<WH1004> [and] join<WH7126> field<WH7704> to field,<WH7704> Until<WH5704> there is no<WH657> more<WH657> room,<WH4725> So that you have to live<WH3427> alone<WH905> in the midst<WH7130> of the land!<WH776>

In my ears<WH241> the Lord<WH3068> of hosts<WH6635> [has sworn,] "Surely,<WH518> <WH3808> many<WH7227> houses<WH1004> shall become<WH1961> desolate,<WH8047> [Even] great<WH1419> and fine<WH2896> ones,<WH2896> without<WH369> occupants.<WH3427>
"For ten<WH6235> acres<WH6776> of vineyard<WH3754> will yield<WH6213> [only] one<WH259> bath<WH1324> [of wine,] And a homer<WH9149> of seed<WH2233> will yield<WH6213> [but] an ephah<WH374> of grain."

Woe<WH1945> to those who rise<WH7925> early<WH7925> in the morning<WH1242> that they may pursue<WH7291> strong<WH7941> drink;<WH7941> Who stay<WH309> up late<WH309> in the evening<WH5399> that wine<WH3196> may inflame<WH1814> them!

And their banquets<WH4960> are [accompanied] by lyre<WH3658> and harp,<WH5035> by tambourine<WH8596> and flute,<WH2485> and by wine;<WH3196> But they do not pay<WH5027> attention<WH5027> to the deeds<WH6467> of the Lord,<WH3068> Nor<WH3808> do they consider<WH7200> the work<WH4639> of His hands.<WH3027>

Therefore<WH3651> My people<WH5971> go<WH1540> into exile<WH1540> for their lack<WH1097> of knowledge;<WH1847> And their honorable<WH9202> men<WH4962> are famished,<WH7458> And their multitude<WH1995> is parched<WH6704> with thirst.<WH6772>

Therefore<WH3651> Sheol<WH7585> has enlarged<WH7337> its throat<WH5315> and opened<WH6473> its mouth<WH6310> without<WH1097> measure;<WH2706> And Jerusalem's splendor,<WH1926> her multitude,<WH1995> her din<WH7588> [of revelry,] and the jubilant<WH5938> within her, descend<WH3381> [into it.]
So the [common] man<WH120> will be humbled,<WH7817> and the man<WH376> of [importance] abased,<WH8213> The eyes<WH5869> of the proud<WH1364> also will be abased.<WH8213>
But the Lord<WH3068> of hosts<WH6635> will be exalted<WH1361> in judgment,<WH4941> And the holy<WH6918> God<WH410> will show<WH6942> Himself holy<WH6942> in righteousness.<WH6666>
Then the lambs<WH3532> will graze<WH7462> as in their pasture,<WH1699> And strangers<WH1481> will eat<WH398> in the waste<WH2723> places<WH2723> of the wealthy.<WH4220>
Woe<WH1945> to those who drag<WH4900> iniquity<WH5771> with the cords<WH9112> of falsehood,<WH7723> And sin<WH2403> as if with cart<WH5699> ropes;<WH5688>

Who say,<WH559> "Let Him make<WH4116> speed,<WH4116> let Him hasten<WH2363> His work,<WH4639> that we may see<WH7200> [it;] And let the purpose<WH6098> of the Holy<WH6918> One<WH6918> of Israel<WH3478> draw<WH7126> near<WH7126> And come<WH935> to pass,<WH935> that we may know<WH3045> [it!]"

Woe<WH1945> to those who call<WH559> evil<WH9563> good,<WH9185> and good<WH9185> evil;<WH9563> Who substitute<WH7760> darkness<WH2822> for light<WH216> and light<WH216> for darkness;<WH2822> Who substitute<WH7760> bitter<WH4751> for sweet,<WH4966> and sweet<WH4966> for bitter!<WH4751>
Woe<WH1945> to those who<WH2450> are wise<WH2450> in their own eyes,<WH5869> And clever<WH995> in their own sight<WH5048>!<WH6440>
Woe<WH1945> to those who are heroes<WH1368> in drinking<WH8354> wine,<WH3196> And valiant<WH2428> men<WH376> in mixing<WH4537> strong<WH7941> drink;<WH7941>
Who justify<WH6663> the wicked<WH7563> for a bribe,<WH7810> And take<WH5493> away<WH5493> the rights<WH6666> of the ones who<WH6662> are in the right!<WH6662>

Therefore,<WH3651> as a tongue<WH3956> of fire<WH784> consumes<WH398> stubble,<WH7179> And dry<WH2842> grass<WH2842> collapses<WH7503> into the flame,<WH3852> So their root<WH8328> will become<WH1961> like rot<WH4716> and their blossom<WH6525> blow<WH5927> away<WH5927> as dust;<WH80> For they have rejected<WH3988> the law<WH8451> of the Lord<WH3068> of hosts,<WH6635> And despised<WH5006> the word<WH565> of the Holy<WH6918> One<WH6918> of Israel.<WH3478>

On this<WH3651> account<WH3651> the anger<WH639> of the Lord<WH3068> has burned<WH2734> against His people,<WH5971> And He has stretched<WH5186> out His hand<WH3027> against<WH5921> them and struck<WH5221> them down,<WH5221> And the mountains<WH2022> quaked;<WH7264> and their corpses<WH5038> lay<WH1961> like refuse<WH5478> in the middle<WH7130> of the streets.<WH2351> For all<WH3605> this<WH384> His anger<WH639> is not spent,<WH7725> But His hand<WH3027> is still<WH5750> stretched<WH5186> out.

He will also lift<WH5375> up a standard<WH5251> to the distant<WH7350> nation,<WH1471> And will whistle<WH8319> for it from the ends<WH7097> of the earth;<WH776> And behold,<WH2009> it will come<WH935> with speed<WH4120> swiftly.<WH7031>

No<WH369> one<WH369> in it is weary<WH5889> or stumbles,<WH3782> None<WH3808> slumbers<WH5123> or sleeps;<WH3462> Nor<WH3808> is the belt<WH232> at its waist<WH2504> undone,<WH6605> Nor<WH3808> its sandal<WH5275> strap<WH8288> broken.<WH5423>

Its arrows<WH2671> are sharp,<WH8150> and all<WH3605> its bows<WH7198> are bent;<WH1869> The hoofs<WH6541> of its horses<WH5483> seem<WH2803> like flint,<WH9497> and its [chariot] wheels<WH1534> like a whirlwind.<WH5492>

Its roaring<WH7581> is like a lioness,<WH3833> and it roars<WH7580> like young<WH3715> lions;<WH3715> It growls<WH5098> as it seizes<WH270> the prey,<WH2964> And carries<WH6403> [it] off<WH6403> with no<WH369> one<WH369> to deliver<WH5337> [it.]

And it shall growl<WH5098> over<WH5921> it in that day<WH3117> like the roaring<WH5100> of the sea.<WH3220> If one looks<WH5027> to the land,<WH776> behold,<WH2009> there is darkness<WH2822> [and] distress;<WH9496> Even the light<WH216> is darkened<WH2821> by its clouds.<WH6183>
